topics.body:
I'm going to be working on schoolwork all today, *BUT* while I'm waiting for a program to download here's a bit of news:
In all probability same-sex marriage will be heard by the supreme court in the usa.  There's a very high probability they will by at least a slim margin vote in favor of same-sex marriage or their ruling will expand further on states allowing same-sex marriage.

Basically same-sex marriage will more than likely be legalized in the usa by June 2015 and if not chances are it will be legalized in the supermajority of states soon after.

Tl:dr; same-sex marriage will be legal in all or almost all states in the usa by 2016.

topics.body:
!http://p3.no/filmpolitiet/wp-content/saus/plot_generator/gfx/posters/5431936ad8f49.jpg!

*Choking the flames when the sky's the limit.*

Adam Sandler is a retired firefighter, but one day he realizes that he is heir to his father's stealth fighter. He stages a wedding with his college roomate and fools around, until he falls in love with his maid. Then he pulls himself together and emerges as a better person.

topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54318efe6368721639e80000#post_54318efe6368721639e80000
I think it's going to piss off 90% of the world when you think about it; why?  Cause when the majority of europe and the other countries legalized gay marriage all the countries that oppose it just wrote it off as "europe being europe", but when the usa legalizes gay marriage imagine the billions of people crying "persecuting muh beliefs".

Imagine the shitstorm internationally when it happens:
Countries that oppose gay marriage, "The usa is destroying our culture by them legalizing it in their country even though it doesn't have anything to do with the legality in our country" or "the usa is forcing their gay agenda into our countries" or such; that's going to be funny watching all the butthurt internationally.
